page.title: 19TRANSPORT
page.content: The main London to Edinburgh{railway {line}runs through this area. A train passes every 5 minutes each way. The 125's use this line at top speed. There used to be a{station}at Moss. This was because of the brickworks near by and because of the visitors to the spa town of Askern only 2 miles away. The station was closed in the 1950's. The A19 or the{Great North {Road,}which was the main roadway before the motorways, passes through this area. The original{toll bar built in the 1700's is still to be seen. It is now a petrol station and shop. Travellers had to pay at the toll bar to be able to travel on the next section of the road.
